translation: (1) I swear by the Day of Resurrection
(2) And I swear by the reproaching soul[1800] [to the certainty of resurrection].
footnotes: [1800]- i.e., that of the believer, which blames him when he falls into sin or error.

translation: (3) Does man think that We will not assemble his bones?

arabic_text: بَلَىٰ قَٰدِرِينَ عَلَىٰٓ أَن نُّسَوِّيَ بَنَانَهُۥ
translation: (4) Yes. [We are] Able [even] to proportion his fingertips.
(5) But man desires to continue in sin.[1801]
footnotes: [1801]- Literally, "to sin ahead of him."  This refers to the disbeliever, who denies the Day of Account.

translation: (6) He asks, "When is the Day of Resurrection?"
(7) So when vision is dazzled
(8) And the moon darkens
(9) And the sun and the moon are joined,
(10) Man will say on that Day, "Where is the [place of] escape?"
(11) No! There is no refuge.
(12) To your Lord, that Day, is the [place of] permanence.

arabic_text: يُنَبَّؤُاْ ٱلۡإِنسَٰنُ يَوۡمَئِذِۭ بِمَا قَدَّمَ وَأَخَّرَ
translation: (13) Man will be informed that Day of what he sent ahead[1802] and kept back.[1803]
footnotes: [1802]- i.e., his deeds, which await him in the Hereafter. [1803]- i.e., that which he did not do or which he delayed.

translation: (14) Rather, man, against himself, will be a witness,[1804]
(15) Even if he presents his excuses.

arabic_text: لَا تُحَرِّكۡ بِهِۦ لِسَانَكَ لِتَعۡجَلَ بِهِۦٓ
translation: (16) Move not your tongue with it, [O Muḥammad], to hasten with it [i.e., recitation of the Qur’ān].
(17) Indeed, upon Us is its collection [in your heart] and [to make possible] its recitation.
(18) So when We have recited it [through Gabriel], then follow its recitation.
(19) Then upon Us is its clarification [to you].
(20) No! But you [i.e., mankind] love the immediate
(21) And leave [i.e., neglect] the Hereafter.
(22) [Some] faces, that Day, will be radiant,
(23) Looking at their Lord.[1805]
footnotes: [1805]- The people of Paradise will actually see their Creator in the Hereafter.

translation: (24) And [some] faces, that Day, will be contorted,
(25) Expecting that there will be done to them [something] backbreaking.
(26) No! When it [i.e., the soul] has reached the collar bones[1806]
footnotes: [1806]- At the time it is about to leave the body when one is on the verge of death.

translation: (27) And it is said, "Who will cure [him]?"
(28) And he [i.e., the dying one] is certain that it is the [time of] separation
(29) And the leg is wound about the leg,[1807]
footnotes: [1807]- From the difficulties the person faces at death or his sudden awareness of the realities of both this world and the Hereafter.  It may also refer to his shrouding after death.

translation: (30) To your Lord, that Day, will be the procession.[1808]
footnotes: [1808]- Literally, "driving" or "herding" or "the place to which one is driven."

translation: (31) And he [i.e., the disbeliever] had not believed, nor had he prayed.
(32) But [instead], he denied and turned away.
(33) And then he went to his people, swaggering [in pride].
(34) Woe to you, and woe!
(35) Then woe to you, and woe!
(36) Does man think that he will be left neglected?[1809]
footnotes: [1809]- i.e., to no end, without responsibility, or without being returned to the Creator for judgement.

arabic_text: أَلَمۡ يَكُ نُطۡفَةٗ مِّن مَّنِيّٖ يُمۡنَىٰ
translation: (37) Had he not been a sperm from semen emitted?
(38) Then he was a clinging clot, and [Allāh] created [his form] and proportioned [him]
(39) And made of him two mates, the male and the female.

arabic_text: أَلَيۡسَ ذَٰلِكَ بِقَٰدِرٍ عَلَىٰٓ أَن يُحۡـِۧيَ ٱلۡمَوۡتَىٰ
translation: (40) Is not that [Creator] Able to give life to the dead?
